meanings.definition: An area from which livestock are excluded to allow vegetation to recover.
meanings.sent1: The exclosure was set up to give the plants a chance to grow back.
meanings.sent2: The exclosure helped the grass and trees to grow without being eaten by animals.
meanings.sent3: The exclosure was like a plant paradise where no animals were allowed to snack.
meanings.sent4: The exclosure stood like a shield, protecting the plants from hungry mouths.
meanings.sent5: The exclosure created a safe haven for the vegetation to flourish.

meanings.definition: The act of excluding livestock from an area to allow vegetation to recover.
meanings.sent1: The exclosure of the animals was necessary for the plants to regrow.
meanings.sent2: After the exclosure, the plants had a chance to thrive without being grazed on.
meanings.sent3: The exclosure was like a VIP section for plants, no animals allowed!
meanings.sent4: The exclosure acted as a bouncer, keeping the animals away from the plants.
meanings.sent5: The exclosure was the key to letting nature heal and grow back stronger.
